'''Boogie Woogie Red''' (October 18, 1925 - July 2, 1992)<ref name="Dead">{{cite web|author=Doc Rock |url=http://thedeadrockstarsclub.com/1992.html |title=The Dead Rock Stars Club 1992 - 1993 |publisher=Thedeadrockstarsclub.com |date= |accessdate=2014-01-25}}</ref> was a [[Detroit blues]], [[boogie-woogie]] and [[jazz]] pianist, singer and songwriter.<ref name="AMG"/> He variously worked with [[Sonny Boy Williamson I]], [[Washboard Willie]], [[Baby Boy Warren]], [[Lonnie Johnson (musician)|Lonnie Johnson]], [[Tampa Red]], [[John Lee Hooker]] and [[Memphis Slim]].<ref name="Dead"/>

==Biography==
He was born '''Vernon Harrison''' in [[Rayville, Louisiana]],<ref name="Dead"/> moving to [[Detroit]] in 1927.<ref name="AMG">{{cite web |url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p283/biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Boogie Woogie Red |author=O'Neal, Jim |publisher=[[Allmusic]] |accessdate=February 11, 2010}}</ref> In his adolescence, he began performing in local clubs and went on to work alongside [[Sonny Boy Williamson I]], [[Baby Boy Warren]] and [[John Lee Hooker]].<ref name="AMG"/>

In the mid 1970s, Red used to play solo piano at the Blind Pig, a small bar in [[Ann Arbor, Michigan]]. He recorded his own albums in 1974 and 1977, and toured Europe that same decade.<ref name="AMG"/> Red appeared on [[BBC Television]]'s ''[[Old Grey Whistle Test]]'' in May 1973.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ftvdb.bfi.org.uk/sift/individual/733260?view=credit |title=BFI | Film & TV Database | Boogie Woogie Red |publisher=Ftvdb.bfi.org.uk |date=2009-04-16 |accessdate=2014-01-25}}</ref>

He died in Detroit, in July 1992, at the age of 66.<ref name="Dead"/>

==Discography==
*''Live at the Blind Pig'' (1974) - [[Blind Pig Records]]
*''Red Hot'' (1977) - Blind Pig Records<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/boogie-woogie-red-mn0000096979/discography |title=Boogie Woogie Red | Discography |publisher=AllMusic |date=1925-10-18 |accessdate=2014-01-25}}</ref>
